page.title: 01Slopes South of Maxton
page.content: This is a sparsely populated area to the south of the hamlet of Maxton. It contains only a few scattered settlements although bisected by a trunk round the A68. The area is on ground rising gently to the south of the river Tweed, and the landscape is dominated by the view some 4 miles to the Norht of the the triple peaks of the Eildon Hills. In places the distant Cheviat Hills can also be seen some 15 miles to the south.The main land use is agricultural and the majority of the population in this aea are employed in this sector. however, some may work in nearby villages or small towns, the community of Newtown St Boswells (3 miles) in particular houses the local council office.
